title.narrative: Global Procurement Initiative: Procurement Assistance Program for the Dominican Republic: Phases I and II, through Trade Center Management Associates LLC

description.narrative: This Global Procurement Initiative: Procurement Assistance Program for the Dominican Republic: Phases I and II is a national-level Program that encompasses two separate and distinct activities: a three-day Phase I Workshop in Santo Domingo for 60-80 government procurement officials and up to 20 observers in the October 2017 timeframe; and a Phase II value-based procurement Phase II Study Tour in early 2018. Both activities are to be carried out in collaboration with the Direccion General de Contrataciones Publicas (DGCP), the George Washington University Law School's Government Procurement Law Program (GW) and USTDA's GPI technical specialists. This funding in the amount of $22,464 is being added to a logistics contract to provide funding for an IQC contractor to support USTDA's Global Procurement Initiative: Understanding Best Value (GPI) Procurement Assistance Program for the Dominican Republic Phases I and II. This funding in the amount of $37702 is being added to a logistics contract to provide funding for the IQC contractor to support three (3) more delegates and one (1) additional staff member to support USTDA's Global Procurement Initiative (GPI) Procurement Assistance Program for Dominican Republic: Phase II Study Tour.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: National Port Cybersecurity Assessment Platform, through HudsonAnalytix, Inc.

description.narrative: This grant provides technical assistance for the Fundacin Ramn E. Mella ("FRM"), a leading maritime and port non-profit industry organization in the Dominican Republic, to support the development of a national cybersecurity risk assessment, reporting, and management capability software for port facilities throughout the country. This technical assistance will be provided by New Jersey-based HudsonTrident, Inc. and will support FRM and port operators in the Dominican Republic to implement a software solution that will identify and recommend port-specific cybersecurity solutions and services for procurement.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

title.narrative: Liquified Natural Gas Terminal and Power Plant, through Enterprise - United States Unknown

description.narrative: This grant provides the Dominican Republic's Ministry of Energy and Mines with support to study the feasibility of an LNG terminal and power plant in the northwest part of the country. More specifically, the feasibility study will support the Ministry of Energy and Mines in assessing the site selection and infrastructure requirements for the terminal, re-gasification facility, power plant, and supporting equipment and technologies. The project will offer commercial opportunities for a wide range of U.S. equipment and services related to LNG terminal and gas-fired power generation equipment and technologies.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Punta Cana Biomass and Waste-to-Energy Plant, through Global Energy Solutions, Inc.

description.narrative: The purpose of this activity is to determine the viability of a proposed mixed biomass and refuse-derived fuel energy plant near Punta Cana, Dominican Republic. This feasibility study would evaluate the sources and suitability of fuel stocks and provide estimates of capital and operating costs.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - Energy Storage Regulatory Roadmap, through Enterprise - United States Unknown

description.narrative: This technical assistance grant to the Dominican Republics Superintendent of Electricity will support the development of a regulatory roadmap to support the adoption of regulations necessary to enable the use of battery energy storage systems (BESS) in the Dominican Republic. The technical assistance would help address the gaps within the regulatory framework for BESS, including grid connection, performance, and economic remuneration. Establishing this regulatory framework will enable the export of U.S. energy storage technologies to the Dominican Republic.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - Digital Television Technologies, through Koeppen, Elliot & Associates, Ltd.

description.narrative: The Digital Television Technologies Reverse Trade Mission (RTM) familiarized high-level representatives from the public and private telecommunications sector of the Dominican Republic with the U.S. regulatory framework and technology associated with conversion to digital television. This RTM aimed to help prepare the Dominican Republic for their scheduled conversion to digital television under the Advanced Television Systems Committee, Inc. standard in 2015, and took place in April 2014.
